workflow_runs.name: Functional tests
workflow_runs.display_title: ci: remove bogus check for destination_paths in beermover (#6950)

head_commit.message:
ci: remove bogus check for destination_paths in beermover (#6950)

This check neglects to take into account the fact that there are two
products being beetmoved. Addons and the client. E.g, when the
shipping-phase is `promote-addons`, the client tasks will have no
destination paths, and that is totally valid.

workflow_runs.name: Functional tests
workflow_runs.display_title: Fixes for release promotion on the staging repo (#6768)

head_commit.message:
Fixes for release promotion on the staging repo (#6768)

* taskcluster: enable decision task routes/indices on the staging repo

This lets release promotion automatically find the corresponding on-push
decision task for easier testing.

* taskcluster: turn off release-notify on level1

We don't want to bother/confuse the slack channel for staging releases,
and we don't have the required scopes there anyway.

workflow_runs.name: Functional tests
workflow_runs.display_title: Add mozilla-mobile/releng as CODEOWNERS to Taskcluster / Taskgraph reâ€¦

head_commit.message:
Add mozilla-mobile/releng as CODEOWNERS to Taskcluster / Taskgraph related files (#6774)

Releng acts as CODEOWNERS for these files in many other projects as
well. This way we can help nudge projects towards standardized ways of
doing things which brings benefits to everyone!

Note that we typically review for best practices / security, but don't
want to add friction or get involved in the minor details of a CI
pipeline. So in most cases, it would be good to get a review from
someone on the VPN team as well.

workflow_runs.name: Functional tests
workflow_runs.display_title: Fix double leading / in mozillavpn.json path property (#6722)

head_commit.message:
Fix double leading / in mozillavpn.json path property (#6722)

Paths like //usr/lib/mozillavpn/mozillavpnnp may cause Firefox to not
find the mozillavpnnp binary

Currently uses disagree on whether it is meant to be absolute or relative to /

From linux/mozillavpn.spec:
%cmake -DWEBEXT_INSTALL_LIBDIR=/usr/lib -DCMAKE_INSTALL_SYSCONFDIR=/etc -DBUILD_TESTING=OFF

From linux/debian/rules:
	dh_auto_configure -- -DWEBEXT_INSTALL_LIBDIR=/lib -DBUILD_ID=$(DEB_VERSION) -DBUILD_TESTING=OFF

Use an absolute path be default for WEBEXT_INSTALL_LIBDIR, as it is
easier when variables point to install dirs in build processes, i.e.
/${lib} is easier than stripping a leading / from %{_libdir}.

workflow_runs.display_title: VPN-4406 [Part 1] Add Inspector command to overwrite connection healtâ€¦

head_commit.message:
VPN-4406 [Part 1] Add Inspector command to overwrite connection health stability (#6704)

Add a new inspector command `force_connection_health` with 3 possible values: stable, unstable, nosignal to forcefully override the connection health stability value for testing purposes.

workflow_runs.name: Functional tests
workflow_runs.display_title: VPN-4493: CMake on Xcode Cloud (round two) (#6658)

head_commit.message:
VPN-4493: CMake on Xcode Cloud (round two) (#6658)

* Update XCode Cloud script to use cmake
* EXTRA: Fix RUST_ARCH selection script
* BUGFIX: Fix type in Info.plist template
* remove bloat from glean xcode config, add install path
* skip install on iosglean
* BUGFIX: Remove incorrect kwarg from subprocess.call
* add network extension to archive, target ipads
* BUGFIX: ignore qtglean generated files
* remove more bloat from the qtglean config
* reorg some stuff, networkext and appext
* Fix Xcode simulator builds
* Rename Swift/Glean bindings to IOSGlean to resolve library conflicts
* Remove iOS/qmake instructions from README
* Fix CFBundleIconName warning for iOS 11 and later
* Silence C++ linker warnings about symbol visiblity.
* Tidy up target/folder organization in Xcode
* Add note about installing Rustup for iOS
* Add Rustup to the dictionary

---------

Co-authored-by: brizental <beatriz.rizental@gmail.com>

Fix linux split-tunnelling (#6505)

* Activate daemon (and transmit fwmark value) before adding rules

* Correct priority of mangle rule

See #6394

When using Raw, the fwmark (and all following routing etc.) is only
applied to the first packet sent out.

Bump serde_json from 1.0.95 to 1.0.96 in /extension/bridge (#6701)

Bumps [serde_json](https://github.com/serde-rs/json) from 1.0.95 to 1.0.96.
- [Release notes](https://github.com/serde-rs/json/releases)
- [Commits](https://github.com/serde-rs/json/compare/v1.0.95...v1.0.96)

---
updated-dependencies:
- dependency-name: serde_json
  dependency-type: direct:production
  update-type: version-update:semver-patch
...

Signed-off-by: dependabot[bot] <support@github.com>
Co-authored-by: dependabot[bot] <49699333+dependabot[bot]@users.noreply.github.com>
